tasks.task: Pruning a tree branch to promote growth of a specific bud
subtasks: Observing the angle of the branch (45 degrees)
Identifying the location of auxins and hormones around the branch's tip
Locating the target bud beneath the tip
Determining the effect of incorrect cutting positions (e.g., vertical growth)
Making a cutting decision based on desired bud orientation (outward vs upward)

tasks.task: Understanding bud angles and their impact on growth direction
subtasks: Recognizing the upward-growing bud's current position
Assessing the consequences of cutting the branch at different locations (top versus bottom)
Predicting the growth pattern of the bud when cut at the bottom outward facing node

tasks.task: Bisecting a tree angle to manage bud development
subtasks: Identifying the corner tip where auxin is concentrated
Halving the angle to determine the optimal cutting point for bud stimulation
Ensuring the cut maintains or redirects the desired growth trajectory
